org.lsmr.vending.hardware

Class PopCanRack

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.lsmr.vending.hardware.AbstractHardware<PopCanRackListener>
      • org.lsmr.vending.hardware.PopCanRack
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AbstractPopCanAcceptor

    public final class PopCanRack
extends AbstractHardware<PopCanRackListener>
implements AbstractPopCanAcceptor
    Represents a storage rack for pop cans within the vending machine. More than one would typically exist within the same vending machine. The pop can rack has finite, positive capacity. A pop can rack can be disabled, which prevents it from dispensing pop cans.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class org.lsmr.vending.hardware.AbstractHardware

    • Constructor Detail

      • PopCanRack

        public PopCanRack(int capacity)
        Creates a new pop can rack with the indicated maximum capacity. The pop can rack initially is empty.
        Parameters:
        capacity - Positive integer indicating the maximum capacity of the rack.
        Throws:
        SimulationException - if the indicated capacity is not positive.

    • Method Detail

      • size

        public int size()
        The current number of pop cans stored.
        Returns:
        The current count. Will be non-negative.

      • getCapacity

        public int getCapacity()
        Returns the maximum capacity of this pop can rack. Causes no events.
        Returns:
        The maximum number of items that this device can store.

      • connect

        public void connect(PopCanChannel sink)
        Connects the pop can rack to an outlet channel, such as the delivery chute. Causes no events.
        Parameters:
        sink - The channel to be used as the outlet for dispensed pop cans.

      • acceptPopCan

        public void acceptPopCan(PopCan popCan)
                  throws CapacityExceededException,
                         DisabledException
        Adds the indicated pop can to this pop can rack if there is sufficient space available. If the pop can is successfully added to this pop can rack, a "popCanAdded" event is announced to its listeners. If, as a result of adding this pop can, this pop can rack has become full, a "popCansFull" event is announced to its listeners.
        Specified by:
        acceptPopCan in interface AbstractPopCanAcceptor
        Parameters:
        popCan - The pop can to be added.
        Throws:
        CapacityExceededException - If the pop can rack is already full.
        DisabledException - If the pop can rack is currently disabled.

      • dispensePopCan

        public void dispensePopCan()
                    throws DisabledException,
                           EmptyException,
                           CapacityExceededException
        Causes one pop can to be removed from this pop can rack, to be placed in the output channel to which this pop can rack is connected. If a pop can is removed from this pop can rack, a "popCanRemoved" event is announced to its listeners. If the removal of the pop can causes this pop can rack to become empty, a "popCansEmpty" event is announced to its listeners.
        Throws:
        DisabledException - If this pop can rack is currently disabled.
        EmptyException - If no pop cans are currently contained in this pop can rack.
        CapacityExceededException - If the output channel cannot accept the dispensed pop can.

      • load

        public void load(PopCan... popCans)
          throws SimulationException
        Allows pop cans to be loaded into the pop can rack, to simulate direct, physical loading. Note that any existing pop cans in the rack are not removed. Causes a "popCansLoaded" event to be announced.
        Parameters:
        popCans - One or more pop cans to be loaded into this pop can rack.
        Throws:
        SimulationException - if the number of cans to be loaded exceeds the capacity of this pop can rack.

      • unload

        public java.util.List<PopCan> unload()
        Unloads pop cans from the rack, to simulate direct, physical unloading. Causes a "popCansUnloaded" event to be announced.
        Returns:
        A list of the items unloaded.
